title: Medical Case: Katie Bryce's Seizures and Aneurysm
description: A teenage patient, Katie Bryce, is admitted with unexplained seizures, challenging the new surgical interns to diagnose and treat her. The case tests their medical skills and teamwork as they work through failed treatments and dead ends, ultimately leading to the discovery of a hidden aneurysm caused by a minor fall. The resolution of Katie's case marks a pivotal moment in the interns' first day and establishes their roles within the hospital.
main_characters: Meredith Grey; Cristina Yang; Katie Bryce
interfering_episode_characters: Derek Shepherd; Miranda Bailey; George O'Malley; Izzie Stevens; Alex Karev; Preston Burke
single_episode_progression_string: Katie Bryce is admitted with seizures. Meredith is assigned to Katie's care. Cristina and Meredith discuss possible diagnoses. Katie has additional seizures and requires emergency intervention. Meredith and Cristina review Katie's medical history. Meredith identifies a minor fall as the cause of a subarachnoid hemorrhage from a burst aneurysm. Dr. Shepherd confirms the diagnosis and selects Meredith to assist in surgery. Meredith assists Dr. Shepherd in repairing Katie's aneurysm.

title: Medical Case: George O'Malley's Appendectomy Complication
description: George O'Malley is given his first major surgical opportunity as a new intern when he is selected to perform an appendectomy. The experience tests his skills and confidence, resulting in a significant mistake that shapes his reputation among his peers and sets the tone for his journey as a surgical intern.
interfering_episode_characters: Dr. Preston Burke; Dr. Miranda Bailey; Meredith Grey; Cristina Yang; Izzie Stevens; Alex Karev; Surgical Interns
single_episode_progression_string: Dr. Burke selects George O'Malley to perform an appendectomy. George removes the appendix. George accidentally tears the cecum, causing internal bleeding. Dr. Burke takes over and completes the surgery. Dr. Burke criticizes George for his mistake. The interns nickname George '007' after the incident.

title: Medical Case: Tony's Coronary Bypass and Death
description: Izzie Stevens participates in the care of Tony, a coronary bypass patient, and faces the harsh realities of surgical outcomes when Tony dies during the operation. Izzie learns the importance of honest communication with patients' families and the emotional toll of delivering tragic news.
single_episode_progression_string: Izzie reassures Gloria that Tony will be fine before surgery. Tony undergoes coronary bypass surgery with Dr. Burke. Tony dies during the operation due to extensive heart damage. Dr. Burke scolds Izzie for making promises to the patient's family. Izzie informs Gloria of Tony's death. Gloria is devastated and asks Izzie to leave.

title: Medical Case: Cristina Yang's Post-Operative Diagnosis and Recognition
description: Cristina Yang demonstrates her diagnostic abilities by managing a post-operative patient who develops complications, correctly identifying pneumonia and later diagnosing a pulmonary embolism, earning recognition from Dr. Burke.
interfering_episode_characters: Dr. Burke; Nurse Tyler; Alex Karev
single_episode_progression_string: Cristina is assigned to take lab samples for a post-op patient. Cristina diagnoses the patient with post-op pneumonia and orders antibiotics. A nurse questions Cristina's diagnosis, but Cristina insists. The patient develops a post-op fever. Dr. Burke questions Cristina about the cause of the fever. Cristina lists the five W's of post-op fever and suggests a pulmonary embolism. Dr. Burke removes another intern from the case and tells him to follow Cristina's instructions.

title: Meredith Grey's Struggle with Her Mother's Legacy and Search for Independence
description: Meredith Grey faces the challenge of living in the shadow of her mother Ellis Grey's surgical legacy while coping with Ellis's declining mental health. Throughout her early days as a surgical intern, Meredith grapples with expectations, her mother's reputation, and her own sense of identity, ultimately seeking to establish independence and build a new support system.
interfering_episode_characters: Derek Shepherd; Cristina Yang; George O'Malley; Izzie Stevens; Preston Burke
single_episode_progression_string: Meredith narrates her insecurity about living up to her mother's reputation. Meredith tells Derek she is selling her mother's house. The other interns discuss Meredith's connection to Ellis Grey. Dr. Burke recognizes Meredith as Ellis Grey's daughter. Meredith decides not to sell her mother's house and plans to make it her home. Meredith visits Ellis, who does not recognize her. Meredith tells her mother she is a doctor.

title: Meredith and Derek's Secret Relationship and Professional Boundaries
description: Meredith Grey and Derek Shepherd begin a secret romantic relationship after a one-night stand, only to discover they must work together as intern and attending at the same hospital. Their relationship is tested by hospital rules, the need for secrecy, and Meredith's desire to be recognized for her skills rather than her personal connections.
interfering_episode_characters: Cristina Yang; Miranda Bailey; George O'Malley; Izzie Stevens
single_episode_progression_string: Meredith and Derek wake up together after a one-night stand. Meredith discovers Derek is her new attending at the hospital. They agree to keep their previous night a secret and maintain professionalism. Meredith and Derek interact awkwardly during rounds and patient care. Meredith questions Derek about whether she was chosen for surgery because of their night together. Derek insists Meredith earned the opportunity. Meredith offers to give the surgery to Cristina, but Derek refuses. Meredith and Derek maintain a professional front in front of colleagues.

title: The Interns' Formation of Friendships, Rivalries, and Survival in Surgical Residency
description: Meredith, Cristina, George, Izzie, and Alex begin their surgical internships together, quickly forming bonds and rivalries as they navigate the pressures of residency. Their relationships are shaped by competition for recognition, personal challenges, and the demands of the hospital, resulting in both camaraderie and conflict as they learn to trust, challenge, and support each other while striving to survive and succeed.
main_characters: Meredith Grey; Cristina Yang; George O'Malley; Izzie Stevens; Alex Karev
interfering_episode_characters: Miranda Bailey; Derek Shepherd; Preston Burke; Katie Bryce
single_episode_progression_string: Meredith, Cristina, George, and Izzie meet as new interns and introduce themselves. The group jokes about their resident's nickname and discusses rumors about each other. Cristina and Meredith bond over ambition and frustration with their assignments. George is chosen for surgery, and the others bet on his performance. George fails in surgery and is nicknamed '007' by the group. Cristina and Meredith agree to work together to solve Katie's case and negotiate who will get the surgery if they succeed. Cristina is disappointed when Meredith is chosen for the surgery, causing tension. Cristina accuses Meredith of getting opportunities due to her connections. Meredith offers the surgery to Cristina, but Cristina refuses. Izzie and George bond over insecurities and family expectations. The interns eat together, share frustrations, and begin to form a support system. Meredith decides not to sell her mother's house and invites the others to be her roommates.

title: Dr. Bailey's Mentorship and the Hospital's Hierarchy
description: Dr. Miranda Bailey, known for her strict and demanding approach, oversees the surgical interns as they navigate the hospital's hierarchy. Her tough love, high expectations, and enforcement of discipline shape the interns' growth, opportunities, and challenges, while the power dynamics between residents, attendings, and interns influence their experiences and development throughout their training.
interfering_episode_characters: George O'Malley; Meredith Grey; Cristina Yang; Izzie Stevens; Alex Karev; Dr. Preston Burke; Dr. Derek Shepherd
single_episode_progression_string: Dr. Bailey introduces herself to the interns and establishes her five strict rules. She assigns each intern specific tasks and responsibilities. Bailey warns the interns about the competition and difficulty of the program. She scolds George for his surgical mistake and allows the group to nickname him '007.' Bailey reprimands Meredith for not paging her during Katie Bryce's code. She instructs Izzie to inform a patient's wife of his death and warns against making promises. Bailey enforces discipline and sets clear expectations for the interns' conduct and performance.
